intro: Xochiquetzallia balsensis, commonly known as the Balsam Tree, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and fragrant, white or pink flowers. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits. The Balsam Tree plays an important role in local ecosystems and horticulture.
